title: Week 2 Quiz: Forecasting
description: Test your knowledge of forecasting methodologies and professional register.

items.prompt: A bottom-up forecast for a retail store would likely start with:
options: Average spend per customer and footfall
items.explanation: Bottom-up starts with internal operational drivers.

items.prompt: Which phrase expresses the most caution?
options: One cannot rule out the possibility of success.
items.explanation: 'One cannot rule out' is a classic C1 hedging phrase.

items.prompt: Churn rate is a measure of:
options: The speed of the factory machines
items.explanation: High churn is a negative indicator for growth.

options: The percentage of a market that consumes a product
The cost of building a factory
items.explanation: It shows how much of the target audience is actually buying.

options: Predictable fluctuations that occur at specific intervals
The length of the annual report
items.explanation: Examples include higher sales in December for retailers.
